medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of abdominal pain with associated nonbilious vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began at 4 years of age with occasional episodes of abdominal pain a few times per year, sometimes associated with constipation or vomiting. At 8 years, she experienced a sudden episode of sharp left chest pain. Over 18 months, abdominal pain episodes became more frequent, occurring up to three or four times weekly, particularly during school. Pain was typically epigastric and associated with vomiting. At 9 years and 4 months, she was seen for sharp, crampy epigastric pain, and during a follow-up at 9 years and 11 months, she experienced severe abdominal pain radiating to the back.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic constipation; history of asthma; pneumonia at 2 years of age.
medical_history.family_history: Father with gastroesophageal reflux disease; sister with hyperthyroidism; maternal grandmother and aunts with migraines. No family history of celiac disease, Crohnâ€™s disease, ulcerative colitis, or irritable bowel syndrome.
medical_history.social_history: Relatively low-fiber diet; lived with parents; attended school as an excellent student; traveled to South America at age 8.
